remarks: Lemma for ~ lshpkrex .  Show uniqueness of ring multiplier ` k ` when a vector ` X ` is broken down into components, one in a hyperplane and the other outside of it .  TODO: do we need the ~ cbvrexv for ` a ` to ` c ` ?  (Contributed by NM, 4-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lshpsmreu.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu.a $e |- .+ = ( +g ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu.h $e |- H = ( LSHyp ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lshpsmreu.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. H ) $.
lshpsmreu.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. V ) $.
lshpsmreu.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
lshpsmreu.e $e |- ( ph -> ( U .(+) ( N ` { Z } ) ) = V ) $.
lshpsmreu.d $e |- D = ( Scalar ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu.k $e |- K = ( Base ` D ) $.
lshpsmreu.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` W ) $.
lshpsmreu $p |- ( ph -> E! k e. K E. y e. U X = ( y .+ ( k .x. Z ) ) ) $.
$d .+ k y $.
$d .x. k y $.
$d K k $.
$d U k y $.
$d X k y $.
$d Z k y $.
